## Load libraries
```{r }
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(purrr)
library(openxlsx)
library(tidyr)
library(stringr)
```

```{r }
split_files <- function(x) {
  if (is.null(x) || x == "") character(0)
  else strsplit(x, "\\s+")[[1]]
}

filter_files_by_sample <- function(files, valid_samples, suffix_regex) {
  files %>%
    keep(~ {
             sample_id <- sub(suffix_regex, "", tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(.x)))
      sample_id %in% valid_samples
    })
}
```

## Get results
```{r }
## Check hybracter completeness
hybracter_complete <- map_dfr(
  split_files(params$hybracter_summary),
  function(f) {
      read_tsv(f, show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
          mutate(sample_id = tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f))) %>%
          mutate(sample_id = sub("_hybracter_summary", "", sample_id)) %>%
          mutate(Number_circular_plasmids = as.numeric(Number_circular_plasmids))
  }
)

## Filter out incomplete assemblies
complete_samples <- hybracter_complete %>%
  filter(Complete == "TRUE") %>%
  pull(sample_id) %>%
  unique()


hybracter_per_contig_files <- filter_files_by_sample(
  split_files(params$hybracter_per_contig),
  complete_samples,
  "_per_contig_stats"
)

plassembler_files <- filter_files_by_sample(
  split_files(params$plassembler_files),
  complete_samples,
  "_plassembler_summary"
)


mlst_files <- filter_files_by_sample(
  split_files(params$mlst_files),
  complete_samples,
  "_renamed"
)

rmlst_files <- filter_files_by_sample(
  split_files(params$mlst_files),
  complete_samples,
  "_rmlst"
)

plasmidfinder_files <- filter_files_by_sample(
  split_files(params$plasmidfinder_files),
  complete_samples,
  "_results"
)

kleborate_files <- filter_files_by_sample(
  split_files(params$kleborate_files),
  complete_samples,
  "_kleborate_out"
)

amrfinder_files <- filter_files_by_sample(
  split_files(params$amrfinder_files),
  complete_samples,
  "\\.tsv$"
)


## Hybracter per contig summary
hybracter_df <- map_dfr(
  hybracter_per_contig_files,
  function(f) {
    read_tsv(f, show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
      select(contig_name, contig_type, length, gc, circular) %>%
      rename(contig = contig_name) %>%
      mutate(sample_id = tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f))) %>%
      mutate(sample_id = sub("_per_contig_stats", "", sample_id))
  }
)


plassembler_df <- map_dfr(
  plassembler_files,
  function(f) {
    read_tsv(f, show_col_types = FALSE, col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>%
        mutate(sample_id = tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f))) %>%
        mutate(sample_id = sub("_plassembler_summary", "", sample_id))
  }
)

plassembler_df <- plassembler_df %>%
      mutate(
        contig = ifelse(
          contig != "chromosome",
          paste0("plasmid0000", contig),
          "chromosome00001"
        )) %>%
      select(sample_id, 1:15) %>%
      select(-length)


## MLST
mlst_df <- map_dfr(
  mlst_files,
  function(f) {
    read_tsv(f, col_names = FALSE, show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
      select(X2, X3) %>%
      rename(Species = X2, ST = X3) %>%
      mutate(
        contig = "chromosome00001",
        sample_id = tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f)),
        ST = as.character(ST)
      ) %>%
      mutate(sample_id = sub("_renamed", "", sample_id))
  }
)

## rMLST
rmlst_df <- map_dfr(
    split_files(params$rmlst_files),
    function(f) {
    tbl <- read_tsv(f, col_names = FALSE, show_col_types = FALSE)

    taxon_line   <- tbl$X1[str_detect(tbl$X1, "^Taxon:")]
    support_line <- tbl$X1[str_detect(tbl$X1, "^Support:")]

    tibble(
      sample_id = sub("_rmlst.*$", "", basename(f)),
      contig    = "chromosome00001",
      species   = str_remove(taxon_line, "^Taxon:"),
      support   = str_remove(support_line, "^Support:")
    )
  }
)


## AMRFinderPlus results
amrfinderplus_df <- map_dfr(
#  amrfinder_files,
  split_files(params$amrfinder_files),
  function(f) {
    read_tsv(f, show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
        mutate(sample_id = tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f))) %>%
    filter(`% Coverage of reference` >= 90,
         `% Identity to reference` >= 90) %>%
    select(
        sample_id,
        `Contig id`,
        `Element symbol`,
        Type, Subtype, Class, Subclass
    ) %>%
    rename(contig = `Contig id`) %>%
    mutate(
        sort_level = case_when(
        Type == "STRESS" & !is.na(Class)     ~ paste(Type, Class),
        Type == "STRESS" & is.na(Class)      ~ paste(Type, Subtype),
        Type == "AMR" & Subtype == "POINT"   ~ paste(Subtype, Class),
        Type == "AMR" & Subtype == "AMR"     ~ Class,
        Type == "VIRULENCE"                  ~ Type
        )
    )
  }
)

amrfinderplus_df2 <- amrfinderplus_df %>%
  arrange(sample_id, contig, sort_level, `Element symbol`) %>%
  group_by(sample_id, contig, sort_level) %>%
  summarise(
    `Element symbol` = paste(unique(`Element symbol`), collapse = "; "),
    .groups = "drop"
  ) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = sort_level, values_from = `Element symbol`)

plasmidfinder_df <- map_dfr(
  plasmidfinder_files,
  function(f) {
    read_tsv(f, show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
      select(Plasmid, Contig) %>%
      rename(contig = Contig) %>%
      mutate(
        contig = gsub(" .*", "", contig),
        sample_id = tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f))
      ) %>%
      mutate(sample_id = sub("_results", "", sample_id)) %>%
      group_by(sample_id, contig) %>%
      summarise(
        Plasmid = paste(unique(Plasmid), collapse = "; "),
        .groups = "drop"
      )
  }
)

## Kleborate result
kleborate_df <- map_dfr(
  kleborate_files,
  function(f) {
    if (file.info(f)$size == 0) {
      return(tibble(
        sample_id = sub("_kleborate_out", "", tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f))),
        contig    = "chromosome00001"
      ))
    }
    read_tsv(f, show_col_types = FALSE, col_types = cols(.default = "c")) %>%
      mutate(
        sample_id = tools::file_path_sans_ext(basename(f)),
        contig = paste0(sub("^[^_]*_", "", strain), "00001")
      ) %>%
      mutate(sample_id = sub("_kleborate_out", "", sample_id)) %>%
      select(-c(1:11))
  }
)

```


## Join all data frames on sample identifiers and contig name columns
```{r }
combined_df <- hybracter_df %>%
  left_join(plassembler_df,    by = c("sample_id", "contig")) %>%
  left_join(plasmidfinder_df,  by = c("sample_id", "contig")) %>%
  left_join(amrfinderplus_df2, by = c("sample_id", "contig")) %>%
  left_join(kleborate_df,      by = c("sample_id", "contig")) %>%
  left_join(mlst_df,           by = c("sample_id", "contig")) %>%
  left_join(rmlst_df,          by = c("sample_id", "contig")) %>%
  arrange(sample_id, contig) %>%
  mutate(
    Species = sub(
      "Klebsiella_pneumoniae_SC",
      "Klebsiella pneumoniae",
      Species
    ),
    circular = as.character(circular)
  ) %>%
  relocate(sample_id, .before = contig) #%>%
  #filter(length >= 1500)

```


## Create top level header for excel sheet (one per tool)
```{r }
## Create multilevel headers
group_map <- list(
  "Hybracter"        = c("sample_id", "contig", "contig_type", "length", "gc", "circular"),
  "MLST"             = setdiff(names(mlst_df), c("contig")),
  "rMLST"            = setdiff(names(rmlst_df), c("contig")),
  "Plassembler"      = setdiff(names(plassembler_df), c("contig")),
  "PlasmidFinder"    = setdiff(names(plasmidfinder_df), c("contig")),
  "AMRFinderPlus"    = setdiff(names(amrfinderplus_df2), c("contig")),
  "Kleborate"        = setdiff(names(kleborate_df), c("contig"))
)

ordered_cols <- c(
  unlist(group_map[["Hybracter"]], use.names = FALSE),
  unlist(group_map[["MLST"]], use.names = FALSE),
  unlist(group_map[["rMLST"]], use.names = FALSE),
  unlist(group_map[["Plassembler"]], use.names = FALSE),
  unlist(group_map[["PlasmidFinder"]], use.names = FALSE),
  unlist(group_map[["AMRFinderPlus"]], use.names = FALSE),
  unlist(group_map[["Kleborate"]], use.names = FALSE)
)

ordered_cols <- intersect(ordered_cols, names(combined_df))
combined_df <- combined_df %>% select(all_of(ordered_cols))

header_map <- bind_rows(
  tibble(column_name = group_map[["Hybracter"]],                   header = "Hybracter"),
  tibble(column_name = group_map[["MLST"]],                        header = "MLST"),
  tibble(column_name = group_map[["rMLST"]],                       header = "rMLST"),
  tibble(column_name = group_map[["Plassembler"]],                 header = "Plassembler"),
  tibble(column_name = group_map[["PlasmidFinder"]],               header = "PlasmidFinder"),
  tibble(column_name = group_map[["AMRFinderPlus"]],               header = "AMRFinderPlus"),
  tibble(column_name = group_map[["Kleborate"]],                   header = "Kleborate")
) %>%
  # Keep only columns that are actually present & order to match combined_df
  filter(column_name %in% names(combined_df)) %>%
  slice(match(names(combined_df), column_name))

top_header <- header_map$header

top_header <- ave(
  top_header,
  top_header,
  FUN = function(x) c(x[1], rep("", length(x) - 1))
)

# Keep bottom header as usual
bottom_header <- names(combined_df)
```

## Write data frame to excel file
```{r }
wb <- createWorkbook()
addWorksheet(wb, "Merged")

# Write top and bottom headers (transpose to write horizontally)
writeData(wb, sheet = 1, x = t(top_header),    startRow = 1, colNames = FALSE)
writeData(wb, sheet = 1, x = t(bottom_header), startRow = 2, colNames = FALSE)

# Write data starting from row 3
writeData(wb, sheet = 1, x = combined_df, startRow = 3, colNames = FALSE)

# Styling
style_top <- createStyle(halign = "center", valign = "center", textDecoration = "bold", border = "bottom", borderStyle = "medium")
style_bottom <- createStyle(textDecoration = "bold", halign = "center", valign = "center")

# Apply styles to headers
addStyle(wb, sheet = 1, style = style_top,    rows = 1, cols = 1:ncol(combined_df), gridExpand = TRUE)
addStyle(wb, sheet = 1, style = style_bottom, rows = 2, cols = 1:ncol(combined_df), gridExpand = TRUE)

# Freeze panes below headers and after key columns (so keys stay visible)
freezePane(wb, sheet = 1, firstActiveRow = 3, firstActiveCol = 1)

# Adjust row height for top header (better visibility)
setRowHeights(wb, sheet = 1, rows = 1, heights = 28)

# Auto adjust column widths
max_width <- sapply(1:ncol(combined_df), function(i) {
  max(nchar(as.character(c(top_header[i], bottom_header[i], combined_df[[i]]))), na.rm = TRUE)
})

setColWidths(wb, sheet = 1, cols = 1:ncol(combined_df), widths = max_width + 3)

# Optional: add filters on bottom header row
addFilter(wb, sheet = 1, rows = 2, cols = 1:ncol(combined_df))

# Style for left border
left_border_style <- createStyle(
  border = "left",
  borderStyle = "medium"
)

# Find indices of non-empty top headers
group_starts <- which(top_header != "")

# Apply left border to the top header row
for (col in group_starts) {
  addStyle(
    wb,
    sheet = 1,
    style = left_border_style,
    rows = 1,       # top header row only
    cols = col,
    gridExpand = TRUE,
    stack = TRUE
  )
}

# Save workbook
saveWorkbook(wb, params$output_file, overwrite = TRUE)
```
